channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Immigrant whose skull was broken in 8 places during ICE arrest says beating was unprovoked
item.description: Alberto Castañeda Mondragón was hospitalized with eight skull fractures and five life-threatening brain hemorrhages. Officers claimed he ran into a wall, but medical staff doubted that account.
item.content:encoded:
Alberto Castañeda Mondragón was hospitalized with eight skull fractures and five life-threatening brain hemorrhages. Officers claimed he ran into a wall, but medical staff doubted that account.

(Image credit: Mark Vancleave)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Pentagon says it's cutting ties with 'woke' Harvard, ending military training
item.description: Amid an ongoing standoff between Harvard and the White House, the Defense Department said it plans to cut ties with the Ivy League — ending military training, fellowships and certificate programs.
item.content:encoded:
Amid an ongoing standoff between Harvard and the White House, the Defense Department said it plans to cut ties with the Ivy League — ending military training, fellowships and certificate programs.

(Image credit: Kevin Wolf)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Temperature check by voters in Minnesota
item.description: In the first electoral temperature check in Minnesota since President Trump launched Operation Metro Surge to ramp up immigration enforcement in the state, voters had a lot to say.
item.content:encoded: In the first electoral temperature check in Minnesota since President Trump launched Operation Metro Surge to ramp up immigration enforcement in the state, voters had a lot to say.
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson

item.title: Covering the immigration surge in Minneapolis as a local
item.description: Meg Anderson, who has been reporting on the Trump administration's immigration campaign in Minneapolis, talks about what it is like to cover a national event in her home town.
item.content:encoded: Meg Anderson, who has been reporting on the Trump administration's immigration campaign in Minneapolis, talks about what it is like to cover a national event in her home town.
item.dc:creator: Emily Kwong

item.title: One week since Nancy Guthrie was last seen, here's what we know
item.description: Nancy Guthrie was last seen a week ago. In the days since, investigators have launched a frantic search to return the 84-year-old home.
item.content:encoded:
Nancy Guthrie was last seen a week ago. In the days since, investigators have launched a frantic search to return the 84-year-old home.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: The CIA World Factbook is dead. Here's how I came to love it
item.description: The Factbook survived the Cold War and became a hit online. It mixed quirky cultural notes and trivia with maps, data, and photos taken by CIA officers. But it was discontinued this week.
item.content:encoded: The Factbook survived the Cold War and became a hit online. It mixed quirky cultural notes and trivia with maps, data, and photos taken by CIA officers. But it was discontinued this week.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: DVDs and public transit: Boycott drives people to ditch Big Tech to protest ICE
item.description: A sweeping boycott has begun — targeting tech giants who participants believe are enabling President Trump and his immigration crackdown.
item.content:encoded:
A sweeping boycott has begun — targeting tech giants who participants believe are enabling President Trump and his immigration crackdown.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Freezing temperatures reveal holes in NYC's attention to the homeless
item.description: New York City has seen a troubling number of deaths during the current cold spell. Mayor Zohran Mamdani says he'll fix what some see as poor communication with city workers who assist the homeless.
item.content:encoded: New York City has seen a troubling number of deaths during the current cold spell. Mayor Zohran Mamdani says he'll fix what some see as poor communication with city workers who assist the homeless.
item.dc:creator: Liz Kim

item.title: Hate them or not, Patriots fans want the glory back in Super Bowl LX
item.description: As Bostonians bemoan their long years of suffering without a Super Bowl win, rival fans gripe that Title Town has become Entitled Town.
item.content:encoded:
As Bostonians bemoan their long years of suffering without a Super Bowl win, rival fans gripe that Title Town has become Entitled Town.

(Image credit: Elizabeth Johnson)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: It's about to get easier for Trump to fire federal workers
item.description: Since his first term, President Trump has wanted to be able to fire federal employees for any reason. A new rule vastly expands his authority to do that.
item.content:encoded:
Since his first term, President Trump has wanted to be able to fire federal employees for any reason. A new rule vastly expands his authority to do that.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu
